705759f-a.text:
Montague Street, at the N.W. corner of Pierrepont Place, showing the
Manhattan Skyline, in the background.
August 10, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
705759f-a.folder: Montague Street & Pierrepont Place, Brooklyn, NY

705776f-b.title: Brooklyn: Montague Terrace - Montague Street
705776f-b.text:
(1)
2-10 Montague Terraoe, from Montague to Remsen Streets, showing in the foreground, the Litchfield Mansion also once the home of George 1. Seeney. The Sanger house is at the extreme left. One of the center homes, now occupied by the National City Bank as a club house, was the residenoe of Jeremiah J. Robinson of the Robinson Stores, located between Fulton and
Montague Streets.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.
(2)
The same, another view.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
705776f-b.folder: Montague Terrace & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY

705778f-a.title: Brooklyn: Montague Terrace - Pierrepont Place
705778f-a.text:
Montague Terrace and Pierrepont Place. A rear view fronting on the above mentioned Street s. The building at left faces Pierrepont Place; the building at right on Montague Terrace. The street in the center of the view is Montague Street. The rear of both these buildings are on Furman Street.
The Pierrepont Stores are at the left.
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
